intro: Crossandra citrina var. subintegra, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow-orange flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Crossandra citrina var. subintegra is popular in ornamental gardening for its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
